author: mpetrunic
content: if you put everything into single zipped files, you could have simple script to extract, git init and git commit which would recreate repo locally?

author: ralexstokes
content: P sure you can already pulled a zipped repo from GitHub

author: ralexstokes
content: Proto was talking about the spec test data

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**protolambda**
The data is now on git LFS, which works great for git versioning and pulling changed tests. But very poor for repeated downloads on clean non-cached machines (some CI here...). However, for consumption purposes they only change per release, so we add gzipped tarballs to the release to allow for non-LFS efficient and unbilled downloads. That should cover the CI re-download use-case much better. But agree we might have to stop putting tests on LFS if high-bandwidth consumption is higher priority than git-like versioning.

author: djrtwo
content:
See â€œBLS Standardisationâ€ under Ben Edgingtonâ€™s recent â€œWhatâ€™s New in Eth2â€
https://benjaminion.xyz/newineth2/20190920.html

Although the BLS Standardisation effort is nearing completion, we canâ€™t deploy the contract until that signature scheme is deemed stable.
After identifying and fixing a vyper compiler bug, the deposit contract has finished formal verification and is ready to go when the standardisation effort is completed

author: mpetrunic
content: If we have attestation with aggregated signature of validator 1 and 2 and we receive attestation with aggregated signature od validators 2 and 3 (notice validator 2 is aggregated in both attestations). How do we aggregate that?
